  "description": "Buckler Systems is a Nigerian defense solutions provider with strong expertise in manufacturing civilian armored vehicles, design, and prototyping of military vehicles and ordnance equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Sales and Marketing Executive at Buckler Systems is responsible for developing and executing comprehensive sales and marketing strategies to promote and sell the company&rsquo;s products and services.
	This role involves conducting market research, analysing competitors, identifying new business opportunities, and preparing persuasive presentations and proposals for prospective clients.
	The manager will also oversee customer relationships, drive marketing campaigns, and potentially supervise a sales and marketing team.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement integrated sales and marketing strategies that align with Buckler Systems&rsquo; business goals.
	Set clear performance targets and tactical plans to grow market share and revenue.
	Conduct regular research to identify emerging market trends, customer needs, and the competitive landscape.
	Provide insights that inform product positioning and strategic decisions.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities locally and internationally.
	Manage the entire sales cycle from lead generation to closing deals.
	Negotiate and finalize contracts in alignment with company policies.
	Design and execute marketing campaigns across digital and traditional platforms.
	Monitor campaign performance and optimize for engagement and conversions.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	Ensure a seamless client experience through excellent service and prompt support.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations tailored to client needs.
	Create well-structured proposals that clearly communicate the value of Buckler Systems&rsquo; armored vehicles and solutions.
	Manage, mentor, and support the professional development of sales and marketing staff.
	Foster a high-performance culture within the team.


Skills and Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1 &ndash; 3 years of experience in a sales and/or marketing leadership role, preferably in the automobile, defense, or manufacturing sector.
	Professional certification in a Sales or Marketing or related field is desirable
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate teams.
	Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities.
	Experience with CRM platforms, digital marketing tools, and campaign analytics.
	Master&rsquo;s degree is a business related degree is an added advantage.


Additional Information


	Buckler Systems provides an environment that encourages innovation, excellence, and strategic thinking. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the commercial strategy of a forward-thinking defense manufacturing company while engaging in
	impactful, high-level business development initiatives.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to:&nbsp;hr@bucklersystems.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Sales and Marketing Executive Job at Buckler Systems




        
    

        
        Buckler Systems is a Nigerian defense solutions provider with strong expertise in manufacturing civilian armored vehicles, design, and prototyping of military vehicles and ordnance equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Sales and Marketing Executive at Buckler Systems is responsible for developing and executing comprehensive sales and marketing strategies to promote and sell the company’s products and services.
	This role involves conducting market research, analysing competitors, identifying new business opportunities, and preparing persuasive presentations and proposals for prospective clients.
	The manager will also oversee customer relationships, drive marketing campaigns, and potentially supervise a sales and marketing team.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement integrated sales and marketing strategies that align with Buckler Systems’ business goals.
	Set clear performance targets and tactical plans to grow market share and revenue.
	Conduct regular research to identify emerging market trends, customer needs, and the competitive landscape.
	Provide insights that inform product positioning and strategic decisions.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities locally and internationally.
	Manage the entire sales cycle from lead generation to closing deals.
	Negotiate and finalize contracts in alignment with company policies.
	Design and execute marketing campaigns across digital and traditional platforms.
	Monitor campaign performance and optimize for engagement and conversions.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	Ensure a seamless client experience through excellent service and prompt support.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations tailored to client needs.
	Create well-structured proposals that clearly communicate the value of Buckler Systems’ armored vehicles and solutions.
	Manage, mentor, and support the professional development of sales and marketing staff.
	Foster a high-performance culture within the team.


Skills and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1 – 3 years of experience in a sales and/or marketing leadership role, preferably in the automobile, defense, or manufacturing sector.
	Professional certification in a Sales or Marketing or related field is desirable
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate teams.
	Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities.
	Experience with CRM platforms, digital marketing tools, and campaign analytics.
	Master’s degree is a business related degree is an added advantage.


Additional Information


	Buckler Systems provides an environment that encourages innovation, excellence, and strategic thinking. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the commercial strategy of a forward-thinking defense manufacturing company while engaging in
	impactful, high-level business development initiatives.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: hr@bucklersystems.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Maintenance Manager Job at Growth Partner Intermediaries Limited




        
    

        
        Growth Partner Intermediaries Limited is a dedicated HR consulting firm committed to delivering comprehensive human resource solutions to businesses. Our services span recruitment, outsourcing, headhunting, training, people operations and advisory. We exist to empower organizations to focus on their core operations while we expertly handle their HR needs, ensuring efficiency, growth, and people-centredsuccess.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Maintenance Manager
Job Location: Lekki-Epe Expressway, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: General Manager

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are recruiting an experienced Maintenance Manager to oversee the maintenance, repair, and improvement of facilities and infrastructure at a leading resort in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate will ensure smooth operations, manage a skilled team, and maintain a safe, functional, and aesthetically pleasing environment for guests and staff.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise all maintenance activities, including electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and landscaping.
	Implement preventive maintenance programs to reduce downtime.
	Manage budgets, resources, and vendor relationships efficiently.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and regulatory standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Facilities Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in maintenance or facilities management, with 2+ years in a leadership role.
	Strong technical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@mixtafrica.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: If you are driven by operational excellence and enjoy leading maintenance teams in a hospitality environment, this role is for you.

  "description": "Elizabeth Maddeux provides a range of human resources solutions designed to empower your workforce, enhance technical proficiency, refine soft skills, and accelerateorganizational growth for better impacts by enhancing organizational dynamics through a well-rounded and robust human resource intervention.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location:&nbsp;Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Assurance / Quality Control Manager",
  "description": "Tokiye Integrated Medical Service was created to address the critical needs in healthcare project management with an emphasis on effective and efficient service delivery. The company is driven by a passion for excellence and a commitment to professional service, aiming to elevate Nigeria&rsquo;s healthcare system to international standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance / Quality Control Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The QA/QC Engineer will oversee all quality assurance and control functions for construction and equipping of the project, ensuring that structural, architectural, MEP works and medical facility installations meet design intent, engineering standards, regulatory requirements, project specifications and, and aligned with international best practices.
	This role requires a Civil/Structural Engineer with deep knowledge of design interpretation, construction supervision, and quality systems implementation.
	The QA/QC Engineer will work closely with different teams to ensure &ge;95% compliance with design specifications, zero major structural non-conformances, and &ge;98% adherence to inspection and testing schedules, while guiding teams in achieving consistent quality, safety, and technical excellence throughout project life cycle.


Key Responsibilites
Quality Assurance and Control:


	Develop, implement and manage the project quality management plan (QMP), inspection and test plans (ITP), method statements, and quality control procedures.
	Ensure that all construction activities, materials, and workmanship comply with approved drawings, technical specifications, codes, and standards.
	Lead inspection and testing programs for civil, structural, and architectural works, ensuring &ge;98% adherence to the approved quality standards and processes.
	Coordinate quality audits, document findings, and oversee corrective/preventive action implementation.


Quality Control Inspections and Monitoring:


	Conduct regular site inspections of civil, structural, architectural, MEP, and specialized healthcare facility works.
	Review and verify that structural, architectural drawings, materials, equipment, and workmanship comply with approved drawings, specifications, and relevant codes.
	Provide on-site supervision and technical guidance to ensure structural elements are constructed according to approved designs.
	Liaise with the structural team to verify and approve rebar schedules, formwork layouts, load paths, and structural member dimensions prior to construction.
	Oversee incoming materials inspection and verify quality before use or installation.
	Monitor subcontractor and supplier performance against agreed quality standards.
	Liaise with design consultants and contractors to resolve design discrepancies and issue technical clarifications.


Stakeholder and Contract Coordination:


	Work closely with the Design Manager, Project/Site Manager, and Construction Team to ensure technical alignment across disciplines.
	Supervise the structural team, contractors, QA/QC personnel to ensure uniform implementation of quality policies.
	Interface with third-party laboratories, regulatory bodies, and consultants for testing, certification, and approvals.


Non-Conformance Management and Documentation:


	Maintain quality records, including inspection reports, non-conformance reports (NCRs), material test results, and design revisions.
	Identify and document non-conformances (NCRs) and ensure corrective and preventive actions are taken.
	Escalate critical quality issues to the Project Management for immediate resolution.
	Track the closure of NCRs and maintain a log of all quality-related issues.
	Ensure 100% traceability of materials and workmanship through proper documentation.
	Collaborate with the document control team to establish and enforce document control procedures to maintain integrity of quality documentation.


Testings, Performance Monitoring and Reporting:


	Track quality metrics such as non-conformance rates, rework costs, inspection compliance, as-built verification and test results.
	Coordinate laboratory and field tests for concrete, steel, welds, electrical systems, HVAC, and other project components.
	Witness and document all commissioning tests for medical equipment and building systems.
	Ensure &le;2% rework rate and zero major structural quality failures.
	Prepare periodic QA/QC reports highlighting compliance levels, issues, and improvement actions.
	Maintain quality records including inspection reports, test results, certificates, and as-built verification.


Compliance and Regulatory Engagement:


	Ensure compliance with Nigerian building codes, hospital facility standards, HSE regulations, and any international accreditations targeted for the hospital.
	Support inspections by regulatory bodies and provide all required documentation for certification or licensing.
	Stay updated on relevant legislation and quality benchmarks for healthcare facilities.


Continuous Improvement and Training:


	Recommend improvements to quality systems, tools, and processes.
	Conduct toolbox talks and quality awareness sessions for site teams and subcontractors.

Quality Assurance / Quality Control Manager Job at Tokiye Integrated Medical Service




        
    

        
        Tokiye Integrated Medical Service was created to address the critical needs in healthcare project management with an emphasis on effective and efficient service delivery. The company is driven by a passion for excellence and a commitment to professional service, aiming to elevate Nigeria’s healthcare system to international standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance / Quality Control Manager

Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The QA/QC Engineer will oversee all quality assurance and control functions for construction and equipping of the project, ensuring that structural, architectural, MEP works and medical facility installations meet design intent, engineering standards, regulatory requirements, project specifications and, and aligned with international best practices.
	This role requires a Civil/Structural Engineer with deep knowledge of design interpretation, construction supervision, and quality systems implementation.
	The QA/QC Engineer will work closely with different teams to ensure ≥95% compliance with design specifications, zero major structural non-conformances, and ≥98% adherence to inspection and testing schedules, while guiding teams in achieving consistent quality, safety, and technical excellence throughout project life cycle.


Key Responsibilites
Quality Assurance and Control:


	Develop, implement and manage the project quality management plan (QMP), inspection and test plans (ITP), method statements, and quality control procedures.
	Ensure that all construction activities, materials, and workmanship comply with approved drawings, technical specifications, codes, and standards.
	Lead inspection and testing programs for civil, structural, and architectural works, ensuring ≥98% adherence to the approved quality standards and processes.
	Coordinate quality audits, document findings, and oversee corrective/preventive action implementation.


Quality Control Inspections and Monitoring:


	Conduct regular site inspections of civil, structural, architectural, MEP, and specialized healthcare facility works.
	Review and verify that structural, architectural drawings, materials, equipment, and workmanship comply with approved drawings, specifications, and relevant codes.
	Provide on-site supervision and technical guidance to ensure structural elements are constructed according to approved designs.
	Liaise with the structural team to verify and approve rebar schedules, formwork layouts, load paths, and structural member dimensions prior to construction.
	Oversee incoming materials inspection and verify quality before use or installation.
	Monitor subcontractor and supplier performance against agreed quality standards.
	Liaise with design consultants and contractors to resolve design discrepancies and issue technical clarifications.


Stakeholder and Contract Coordination:


	Work closely with the Design Manager, Project/Site Manager, and Construction Team to ensure technical alignment across disciplines.
	Supervise the structural team, contractors, QA/QC personnel to ensure uniform implementation of quality policies.
	Interface with third-party laboratories, regulatory bodies, and consultants for testing, certification, and approvals.


Non-Conformance Management and Documentation:


	Maintain quality records, including inspection reports, non-conformance reports (NCRs), material test results, and design revisions.
	Identify and document non-conformances (NCRs) and ensure corrective and preventive actions are taken.
	Escalate critical quality issues to the Project Management for immediate resolution.
	Track the closure of NCRs and maintain a log of all quality-related issues.
	Ensure 100% traceability of materials and workmanship through proper documentation.
	Collaborate with the document control team to establish and enforce document control procedures to maintain integrity of quality documentation.


Testings, Performance Monitoring and Reporting:


	Track quality metrics such as non-conformance rates, rework costs, inspection compliance, as-built verification and test results.
	Coordinate laboratory and field tests for concrete, steel, welds, electrical systems, HVAC, and other project components.
	Witness and document all commissioning tests for medical equipment and building systems.
	Ensure ≤2% rework rate and zero major structural quality failures.
	Prepare periodic QA/QC reports highlighting compliance levels, issues, and improvement actions.
	Maintain quality records including inspection reports, test results, certificates, and as-built verification.


Compliance and Regulatory Engagement:


	Ensure compliance with Nigerian building codes, hospital facility standards, HSE regulations, and any international accreditations targeted for the hospital.
	Support inspections by regulatory bodies and provide all required documentation for certification or licensing.
	Stay updated on relevant legislation and quality benchmarks for healthcare facilities.


Continuous Improvement and Training:


	Recommend improvements to quality systems, tools, and processes.
	Conduct toolbox talks and quality awareness sessions for site teams and subcontractors.
	Share lessons learned and best practices to prevent quality failures.


Required Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering (Master’s degree in Structural/Construction Engineering an advantage).
	Experience: 10 – 15+ years of experience in QA/QC and construction supervision, including ≥5 years in structural design review and interpretation on large-scale projects (healthcare, institutional, or high-rise preferred).
	Certifications: Professional registration with COREN or equivalent body is mandatory, professional certifications in Quality Management (ISO 9001 Lead Auditor, ASQ CQE, etc.) is preferred.
	Proven knowledge of structural design codes (Eurocodes, BS, ACI, ASCE, etc.) and material testing standards.
	Strong experience in inspection, testing, non-conformance management, and QA/QC documentation.
	Familiarity with BIM/Revit, AutoCAD, and project management tools (Primavera P6, MS Project).


Skills and Competencies:


	In-depth technical knowledge of structural design, QA/QC procedures, testing standards, and construction codes, concrete works, reinforcement detailing, and finishing quality standards.
	Excellent leadership and supervisory skills.
	High attention to detail, analytical mindset, and problem-solving ability.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills, with the ability to coordinate across multiple disciplines.
	Ability to work under pressure with integrity, accountability, and commitment to quality excellence and continuous improvement without compromising relationships.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and QA/QC software tools.
